result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy M. Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy M. Cooper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy M. Cooper was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Jeremy M. Cooper was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Supervision fees
Follow through with Aftercare recommendations
Attend self help meetings
Anger management counseling as directed by PO
Obtains HSED
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy M. Cooper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:47 am - Defendant Jeremy M. Cooper in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14fo558, 14fo557, 15cf04, 14cm442, 14cf244 and 14cm234.  State moves to dismiss 14fo557-558 - Granted.  In case 15cf04 - State moves to Dismiss Counts 2 and 3 and Amend Count 1 Misdeamnor Bail Jump - 946.49(1)(a) a Class A Misdemeanor.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Counts 1 and 4.  In Case 14cm442 - State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 3 and 4 - Granted.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2.  In Case 14cf244 - State moves to amend Count 1 to Simple Battery a Class A Misdemeanor - 940.19(1) and dismiss counts 2, 3 and 4 - Granted  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1.  In case 14cm234 Defendant pleads guilty.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Joy/Court statement to sentencing.  Costs/fine to be taken from posted bond.
Court Sentence 14cf244
Impose and Stay Jail 9 months w/Huber for all purposes
Probation 3 yrs
Fine $1,000.00 inclusive of all costs
Any other conditions/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO
Court Sentence 15cf04, 14cm442 and 14cm234
WHS/POP 3 yrs
CC/Domestic Abuse Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Follow through with Aftercare recommendations
Attend self help meetings
Anger management counseling as direct by PO
Obtain HSED
Obtain/maintain full time employment/student status
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Adjourned 12:19 p.m.

02:29 pm - Defendant Jeremy M. Cooper in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14fo557-558, 14cm234, 14cf244, 14cm442and 15cf04.  Michlig states trying to obtain verification of treatment - Joint request for adjournment.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
No contact provision of bond lifted

02:11 pm - Defendant Jeremy M. Cooper in court with attorney Jeffery Arthur Joy.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf244 (PH), 15cf04 (AIA), 14cm442, 14fo558, 14fo557 and 14cm234 (STC).    Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information - Joy in receipt, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  In Case 15cf04 - Joy in receipt of complaint, waives  reading - set for prelim - time limits waived.  Pretrial conference date requested for all cases.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy M. Cooper in court.  Michael H. Schiek  appeared for the State of Wisconsin
1:17
COoper statement - has tried contacting Attorney Joy -- heard he was on vacation - but will try to get ahold of him 

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

01:32 pm - Defendant Jeremy M. Cooper in court, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant states Attorney Jeff Joy represents on underlying case, 14cf244.  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
